{"step_by_step_thinking": "Comprehensive emergency obstetric care includes all interventions that are necessary to manage complications that arise during pregnancy, childbirth, and the postpartum period. This includes manual removal of placenta, which is often necessary in cases of retained placenta. Blood transfusion is also included, as it is often necessary in cases of severe bleeding. Cesarean section is a surgical procedure that is often necessary in cases of obstructed labor or other complications. Hysterectomy, on the other hand, is a surgical procedure to remove the uterus. It is not typically part of emergency obstetric care, as it is not a procedure that is used to manage complications that arise during pregnancy, childbirth, or the postpartum period.", "answer_choice": "B. Hysterectomy"}
